moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Ba4 Nf6: This is madness! When asked my chess playing friends what they think of this move, all I recieved "Instant lose!" and such.. But I believed in this move, which I was analyzing. I don't remember much what I was thinking back then, but it seems that I either get the piece back, get the bishop to a (seemingly) good place (g3) or a (seemingly) strong attack on the a2-g8 diagonal

opening: Ruy Lopez (C79), Steinitz defence deferred (Russian defence)
